questions.question: What is the primary use of 'lorem ipsum'?

answers.text: To serve as placeholder text in design.
To provide meaningful content for websites.
To translate text into Latin.
To enhance readability of documents.
A scrambled section of 'De Finibus Bonorum et Malorum' by Cicero.
A random set of Latin words created by designers.
A famous poem from Ancient Rome.
A traditional Latin saying.

questions.question: Which part of the text is often used in 'lorem ipsum' filler?

answers.text: The beginning sections of Cicero's writings.
Words from a middle section of 'De Finibus Bonorum et Malorum'.
Random text from any Roman text.
Endnotes of famous historical Latin texts.

questions.question: How long has 'lorem ipsum' been used as placeholder text?

answers.text: Since the 20th century
Since the 16th century
Since the 17th century
Since the 21st century

questions.question: Why is 'lorem ipsum' beneficial in design?

answers.text: It prevents readers from being distracted by the content.
It provides accurate translations.
It enhances the color scheme.
It guides the alignment of images.
